Package net.minestom.server.utils

Class PacketUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.minestom.server.utils.PacketUtils
  • public final class PacketUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utils class for packets. Including writing a ServerPacket into a ByteBuf for network processing.

    • Method Detail

      • sendGroupedPacket

        public static void sendGroupedPacket​(@NotNull
                                     java.util.Collection<Player> players,
                                     @NotNull
                                     ServerPacket packet,
                                     @Nullable
                                     PlayerValidator playerValidator)
        Sends a ServerPacket to multiple players.

        Can drastically improve performance since the packet will not have to be processed as much.

        Parameters:
        players - the players to send the packet to
        packet - the packet to send to the players
        playerValidator - optional callback to check if a specify player of players should receive the packet

      • sendGroupedPacket

        public static void sendGroupedPacket​(@NotNull
                                     java.util.Collection<Player> players,
                                     @NotNull
                                     ServerPacket packet)
        Same as sendGroupedPacket(Collection, ServerPacket, PlayerValidator) but with the player validator sets to null.
        See Also:
        sendGroupedPacket(Collection, ServerPacket, PlayerValidator)

      • frameBuffer

        public static void frameBuffer​(@NotNull
                               io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf packetBuffer,
                               @NotNull
                               io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf frameTarget)
        Frames a buffer for it to be understood by a Minecraft client.

        The content of packetBuffer can be either a compressed or uncompressed packet buffer, it depends of it the client did receive a SetCompressionPacket packet before.

        Parameters:
        packetBuffer - the buffer containing compressed or uncompressed packet data
        frameTarget - the buffer which will receive the framed version of from

      • compressBuffer

        public static void compressBuffer​(@NotNull
                                  java.util.zip.Deflater deflater,
                                  @NotNull
                                  byte[] buffer,
                                  @NotNull
                                  io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf packetBuffer,
                                  @NotNull
                                  io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf compressionTarget)
        Compress using zlib the content of a packet.

        packetBuffer needs to be the packet content without any header (if you want to use it to write a Minecraft packet).

        Parameters:
        deflater - the deflater for zlib compression
        buffer - a cached buffer which will be used to store temporary the deflater output
        packetBuffer - the buffer containing all the packet fields
        compressionTarget - the buffer which will receive the compressed version of packetBuffer

      • createFramedPacket

        @NotNull
public static io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf createFramedPacket​(@NotNull
                                                         ServerPacket serverPacket,
                                                         boolean directBuffer)
        Creates a "framed packet" (packet which can be send and understood by a Minecraft client) from a server packet.

        Can be used if you want to store a raw buffer and send it later without the additional writing cost. Compression is applied if MinecraftServer.getCompressionThreshold() is greater than 0.

        Parameters:
        serverPacket - the server packet to write
        Returns:
        the framed packet from the server one
